page.title: 19Overwater Tarn
page.content: Overwater is the largest tarn in Northern Lakeland.Because of its quiet situation it is appreciated by the tourists who penetrate this secluded area.Over the years many large pike have been caught in it,it also has small perch,it is little fished today. There are many wild fowl and in Winter migrant birds from the Arctic areas. Overwater Hall, known as Whitefield House for many years,is now a hotel.It was built in 1840 on the site of an ancient manor farm by Joseph Gillbanks who made a fortune in the West Indies.In a nearby field is a sandstone rubbing stone with a carved head of John Peelthe famous huntsman who lived and hunted over the whole area.In an adjoining field belonging to Orthwaite Hall is an archaeological site,its origin is unknown as it has never been excavated.
